lexUnit.name: cover.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put something on top of or in front of (something) in order to protect or conceal it

sentence.text: We put it to bed in a bowl and cover it in bulb fibre like a blanket .
One girl wanted to cover him in whipped cream and honey and then slowly lick off every bit .
If the site is made of builder 's rubble , cover it with a foot of topsoil .
She covered her mouth with her hand .
Overcome again , she covered her face with her hands and sank onto the settee .
I caught the little boy , but when the child saw me , he covered his eyes with his hands and screamed loudly .
Cover the lid with one colour .
We all found him interesting , so when we lay in the sun after lunch , the white gravel covering our backs with powdery marks , his fighting demonstrations were keenly attended .
He wiped his hands on the wet grass beside the grave and ordered the reluctant soldier back to secure the lid of the coffin and cover it with soil .
Cover the round cake with white icing .
Cover the entire surface with your chosen filling and transfer to an oiled baking sheet .
I had to cover my nose against the terrible stench and just wished my master would finish the business .
Optional : Neatly cover the batten by wrapping fabric round , folding in the ends and holding in place with steel tacks .
Eva had to cover a chair in stapled-together plastic bags before it was hygienic enough for his arse .
Aware now that he was more naked than the other man he turned to the bed , and dragged a sheet off it to cover himself with .
Always cover a sandpit or the local cats will use it as a toilet .
Place the kumquats or orange slices in a pan , cover with water , bring to the boil , strain and discard the water .
Bring to a simmer , cover and cook for 2-3 minutes until just tender , but not collapsing .
